description: This item is a technical part of the capstone project report.
items: The report renders without errors to HTML format and contains at least five chapters of heading level 1 that are named: Introduction, Methods, Results, Conclusions, References.

description: This item is a technical part of the capstone project report.
items: YAML header of report has title, author, date, and table of contents that are correctly displayed in the compiled HTML output.

description: This item is a technical part of the capstone project report.
items: Warnings are hidden from the compiled output, but code is shown in the compiled output.

description: This item is a technical part of the capstone project report.
items: The report has at least two data visualisations.

description: This item is a technical part of the capstone project report.
items: Each data visualisation has edited human-readable labels (e.g. axis labels, legend title).

description: This item is a technical part of the capstone project report.
items: Each data visualisation applies at least of one scaling function (e.g. color/fill, axes).

description: This item is a technical part of the capstone project report.
items: Each data visualisation has a label defined in the code-chunk options.

description: This item is a technical part of the capstone project report.
items: Each data visualisation has a caption defined in the code-chunk options.

description: This item is a technical part of the capstone project report.
items: Each data visualisation is cross-referenced in the narrative using the defined label from the code-chunk options.

description: This item is a technical part of the capstone project report.
items: The report has at least one table with summary statistics (e.g. count, mean, median, standard deviation, etc.).

description: This item is a technical part of the capstone project report.
items: Each table is formatted in the rendered output using a function taught during the course (e.g. kable() function or gt() function).

description: This item is a technical part of the capstone project report.
items: Each table has a label defined in the code-chunk options.

description: This item is a technical part of the capstone project report.
items: Each table has a caption defined in the code-chunk options.

description: This item is a technical part of the capstone project report.
items: Each table is cross-referenced in the narrative using the defined label from the code-chunk options.

description: This item is a technical part of the capstone project report.
items: The report includes at least 3 citations using a bibliography.bib file exported from a collection of references on Zotero.

description: This item is a technical part of the capstone project report.
items: References are automatically listed in References section from YAML entry to bibliography.bib file.

description: This item is a technical part of the capstone project report.
items: Data from Google Sheet is stored in data/raw using a script in 01-data-download.R in project-USERNAME repository

description: This item is part of the data processing and documentation.
items: Data from data/raw folder was imported, cleaned, and stored as analysis-ready processed data in data/processed folder using R code written in 02-data-cleaning.R

description: This item is part of the data processing and documentation.
items: The data/processed folder contains a data dictionary.csv file with two columns (variable_name, description) which document each variable of the data in the same folder.

description: This item is part of the data processing and documentation.
items: The data/processed folder contains a README.md file from a provided template and documentation is completed for the data in the same folder.

description: This item is a workflow part of publishing the capstone project report.
items: The capstone project report is published using GitHub Pages. See instructions below.

description: This item is part of the intellectual framing of the capstone project report.
items: Introduction section with 3 to 5 sentences introduces the context within which the data was created.

description: This item is part of the intellectual framing of the capstone project report.
items: Methods section describes in 3 to 5 sentences how the data was obtained.

description: This item is part of the intellectual framing of the capstone project report.
items: Figures and tables in Results section are interpreted with 2 to 3 sentences each.

description: This item is part of the intellectual framing of the capstone project report.
items: Conclusions concisely summarize findings in a bullet point format.
